alert.note: Alert for Orleans (Vermont) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 19 at 6:58AM EST until December 19 at 7:14PM EST by NWS Burlington
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Vermont... Barton River Near Coventry affecting Orleans County. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Barton River near Coventry. * WHEN...Until this evening. * IMPACTS...Until the river stage falls below 8.0 feet, Maple Street and River Road between Orleans and Coventry Station will remain flooded, and extensive field and lowland flooding will continue. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:30 AM EST Tuesday the stage was 9.5 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 6:30 AM EST Tuesday was 9.6 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage this afternoon and continue falling to 7.5 feet just after midnight tonight. - Flood stage is 8.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 9.2 feet on 04/20/2019. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening at 700 PM EST.
